title: Polenta "in Chains"
introduction: Polenta 'in Chains' is a hearty and comforting dish hailing from the heart of Tuscany. This polenta is harmoniously intertwined with fresh, shredded vegetables, making it a lush vegetarian main, or a savory side to grilled meats. Rich in flavor and tradition, it solidifies beautifully when cooled and achieves a crispy golden brown exterior when fried.
ingredients: 1 cup coarsely ground yellow cornmeal, preferably stone-ground
2 cups cooked or canned cannelini beans
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: In a large saucepan, cook the oil and garlic over medium heat until the garlic is golden, about 2 minutes. Add the cabbage, cover, and cook 10 minutes or until the cabbage is wilted.
Add 3 cups of the water and bring it to a simmer.
In a small bowl, stir together the cornmeal, salt, and remaining 1 cup of water.
Pour the cornmeal mixture into the saucepan. Cook, stirring frequently, until the mixture comes to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, 20 minutes.
Stir in the beans. Cook 10 minutes more or until thick and creamy. Add a little water if the mixture becomes too thick.
Remove from the heat. Stir in the cheese and serve immediately.
